text: Jonathan James "Jon" English (26 March 1949 - 9 March 2016) was an English- born Australian singer, songwriter, musician and actor. He was an early member of the band Sebastian Hardie. He played the role of Judas Iscariot in the Australian production of the stage musical Jesus Christ Superstar in 1972. He also performed in Gilbert and Sullivan's operettas The Pirates of Penzance, The Mikado and H.M.S. Pinafore from 1984. He also acted in a number of television series. As a solo singer, his best known songs were "Turn the Page", "Hollywood Seven", "Words are Not Enough", "Six Ribbons" and "Hot Town". English was born in Hampstead, London. He moved to Sydney as a child in 1961. He had four children. He was a fan of the Parramatta Eels. English died from an aortic aneurysm caused by surgery problems on 9 March 2016 in Newcastle, New South Wales. He was 66. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1949 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Actors from London Category:Actors from Sydney Category:Australian comedians Category:Australian guitarists Category:Australian movie actors Category:Australian rock singers Category:Australian songwriters Category:Australian stage actors Category:Australian television actors Category:Deaths from aortic aneurysm Category:Deaths from surgical complications Category:Musicians from Sydney Category:Naturalised citizens of Australia Category:People from Hampstead Category:Singers from London Category:Writers from Sydney
title: Jon English
